sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Tuberculosis: initial, 250 mg ORALLY every 12 h for 2 weeks, then as tolerated to 250 mg every 6 to 8 h; MAX 1 g daily
  • Urinary tract infectious disease: 15 to 20 mg/kg; MAX 1 gram daily

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono: renal impairment: discontinue if creatinine clearance less than 50 mL/min

0.title: Contraindications
0.mono:
• hypersensitivity to cycloSERINE
  • epilepsy (current or history of)
  • depression, anxiety, psychosis (current or history of)
  • severe renal insufficiency (creatinine clearance less than 50 mL/min)
  • alcohol abuse

3.title: Breast Feeding
3.mono:
• AAP: Maternal medication usually compatible with breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Infant risk is minimal.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: CycloSERINE exerts antimicrobial action by inhibiting cell-wall synthesis. CycloSERINE is an analog of the amino acid D-alanine. It interferes with an early step in bacterial cell wall synthesis in the cytoplasm by competitive inhibition of 2 enzymes, L-alanine racemase, which forms D-alanine from L-alanine, and D-alanine-D-alanine synthetase, which incorporates D-alanine into the pentapeptide necessary for peptidoglycan formation and bacterial cell wall synthesis.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Tmax: 3 to 4 hours.
  • Bioavailability: 70 to 90%
  • Effect of food: Reduced Cmax, Prolonged Tmax (high-fat meals)

sub.title: Distribution
sub.mono:
• Cerebrospinal Fluid: 80% to 100% of serum concentration
  • Vd: 0.11 to 0.26 L/kg

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Fecal: minimal
  • Renal: 50% to 70%
  • Renal Clearance: 0.11 to 0.013 L/hour/kg
  • Dialyzable: yes (hemodialysis)

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• serum drug levels; peak 20 to 35 mcg/mL may provide optimal efficacy
  • improvement in signs and symptoms of infection may be indicative of efficacy
  • serum drug levels; periodically and at least at weekly in patients with renal dysfunction, total daily doses greater than 500 mg, or signs and symptoms of toxicity; to maintain levels less than 30 mcg/mL
  • renal excretion; periodically
  • hematologic panel; periodically
  • hepatic function; periodically
  • neuropsychiatric status; at least monthly and more frequently if symptoms develop
  • signs and symptoms of CNS toxicity in patients receiving a total daily dose greater than 500 mg

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Patient should avoid activities requiring mental alertness or coordination until drug effects are realized.
  • This drug may cause confusion, dizziness, headache, somnolence, or seizure.
  • Instruct patient to report depression, suicidal ideation, or unusual changes in behavior.
  • Advise patients receiving daily doses greater than 500 mg to monitor for and report signs/symptoms of CNS toxicity.
  • Patient should not drink alcohol while taking this drug.
